titles.title: Fair and Justifiable Credit Card Interest Rate Act of 2008
To amend the Truth in Lending Act to impose a cap on the rate of interest that may be charged on consumer credit card accounts, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.summary: 5/7/2008--Introduced. Fair and Justifiable Credit Card Interest Rate Act of 2008 - Amends the Truth in Lending Act to prohibit the annual percentage rate applicable to any extension of credit on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan from exceeding 20%.
